channel.title: üè¢ Ant Group on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Ant Group on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Layer-Wise Natural Gradient Optimizer for Training Deep Neural Networks
item.description: LNGD: A Layer-Wise Natural Gradient optimizer drastically cuts deep neural network training time without sacrificing accuracy.

item.title: Accelerating Pre-training of Multimodal LLMs via Chain-of-Sight
item.description: Chain-of-Sight accelerates multimodal LLM pre-training by ~73% using a multi-scale visual resampling technique and a novel post-pretrain token scaling strategy, achieving comparable or superior perfor…

item.title: Collaborative Refining for Learning from Inaccurate Labels
item.description: Collaborative Refining for Learning from Inaccurate Labels (CRL) refines data using annotator agreement, improving model accuracy with noisy labels.

item.title: DeepITE: Designing Variational Graph Autoencoders for Intervention Target Estimation
item.description: DeepITE: a novel variational graph autoencoder, efficiently estimates intervention targets from both labeled and unlabeled data, surpassing existing methods in recall and inference speed.

item.title: End-to-end Learnable Clustering for Intent Learning in Recommendation
item.description: ELCRec: a novel intent learning model for recommendation, unites behavior representation learning with end-to-end learnable clustering, achieving superior performance and scalability.

item.title: Identify Then Recommend: Towards Unsupervised Group Recommendation
item.description: Unsupervised group recommendation model, ITR, achieves superior user and group recommendation accuracy by dynamically identifying user groups and employing self-supervised learning, eliminating the ne…

item.title: On provable privacy vulnerabilities of graph representations
item.description: Graph representation learning’s structural vulnerabilities are proven and mitigated via noisy aggregation, revealing crucial privacy-utility trade-offs.

item.title: Rethinking Memory and Communication Costs for Efficient Data Parallel Training of Large Language Models
item.description: PaRO boosts LLM training speed by up to 266% through refined model state partitioning and optimized communication.
